properties.Name: Fort Daxio
properties.Info:
Nestled within the Othendin Pass, Fort Daxio is a massive
stronghold and series of military structures under
the rule of the Talâ€™Dorei Council that trains and holds
the bulk of the mobile army of Emon.

properties.Name: Serpent's Head
properties.Info: Surrounded by ruins left by the Cinder King, Serpent's Head is a squat mountain in the southern reaches of the Cliffkeep Mountains.

properties.Name: The Pools of Wittebak
properties.Info: A once peaceful city occupied by thousands of rock gnomes, The Pools of Wittebak harbor now harbor hill giants and the sea hag, Mauvlettir in the dark and toxic caverns beneath the pools.

properties.Name: Murdoon Mines
properties.Info: An iron-rich mine at the base of the Cliffkeep Mountains.

properties.Name: Gatshadow
properties.Info: The monolithic mountain of Gatshadow stands unnaturally tall against the surrounding mountains. It was transformed into a place of evil as the seat of power for a priest of the Betrayer God.

properties.Name: Shadebarrow
properties.Info: Once a monolithic henge used as a ritual site for the hierophant druids, the Shadebarrow is now a forgotten crypt from where treasure hunters and historians seldom return.

properties.Name: Silvercut Crossroads
properties.Info:
Marked by the crossing point between the Silvercut Roadway
and the Wildwood Byway, the Silvercut Crossroads
is a strange and solemn stop along those paths.

properties.Name: Throne of the Archeart
properties.Info:
In the foothills of the Ironseat Ridge is a small rise known
as the Throne of the Archeart: a gathering place for the
many nomadic centaur tribes that ride across the Dividing
Plains.

properties.Name: Torthil
properties.Info: Now just a scarred patch of land, Torthil played an important role in the Scattered War, harboring the ambush that led to the death of King Warren Drassig.

properties.Name: The Shifting Keep
properties.Info: Built within and around a cluster of massive, living trees that form the heart of the Expanse, the Shifting Keep acts as the satellite military compound for the Syngornian scouts and rangers that patrol and defend the surrounding forest.

properties.Name: Tormor Falls
properties.Info:
Feeding the mouth of the rushing Feshun River that
carves through the body of the Expanse, Tormor Falls is an incredible multi-level series of waterfalls that cascade
down the eastern side of Orencleft Mountain for hundreds
of feet.

properties.Name: The Mirescar
properties.Info:
Surrounded by myths in Syngornian folklore, the Mirescar is an extremely dense and seemingly corrupted forest that allows nearly no
sunlight to enter.

properties.Name: Wrettis
properties.Info:
A relic of the Age of Arcanum, Wrettis is the ruined
tower of a powerful mage driven mad by the seductive
whispers of beings from the beyond.

properties.Name: The Ashen Gorge
properties.Info: Once home to Thordak, the Cinder King, the Ashen Gorge (otherwise known as the Dragon's Throne) stands tall with blazing twin peaks as a site of supernatural power.

properties.Name: Cavern of Axiom
properties.Info:
The Cavern of Axiom is a lost shrine to the Knowing
Mistress spoken of only in riddles. Hidden by ever-shifting
illusions, the entrance to this cavern opens only to
those who are expected by fate.

properties.Name: Scar of the Cinder King
properties.Info: Corrupted by the destruction done by Thordak, this area east of Emon radiates an invisible power.
